page.title: 11Farms at West Overton.
page.content: {Mearacre Farm}belonged to Mr. Swanton OBE until 1960 when it was bought by English Farms. Since then it has changed hands several times. It is now called The Mearacre Farms Partnership. This includes farms at Patney and Beechingstoke, and farms in Hampshire. Animals are kept, and corn is grown. Last year there was a farm tour when employees from Hampshire and Temple Farm came along to visit Mearacre Farm. The Swanton family has owned{North {Farm}for 60 years. There are 700 acres of land. The crops grown are wheat, barley, oil seed, and grass. The main problem in the summer is drought. Some of the land is watered regularly to cope with the drought. The Swantons have some pets, but these do not mix with the farm animals.
